New Records: Marcus Semien's walk-off single drove in the game-winning run, securing a 6-5 win for the Texas Rangers over the Seattle Mariners.
Key Match Events: Marcus Semien hit a line single into the left field corner scoring Leody Taveras as the Texas Rangers rallied from a five-run deficit in a 6-5, walk-off win over the Seattle Mariners on Sunday.
Leody Taveras had tied the score at 5-all with a solo homer in the seventh inning and finished with three hits — all from the sixth inning onward.
Wyatt Langford hit a three-run homer off starter Bryan Woo in the sixth inning, cutting the deficit to one run for the Rangers.
Pre-Game Insights: Three-time Cy Young Award winner Max Scherzer, placed on the injured list on Saturday with a hamstring strain, said he would like to return to the Texas Rangers after his contract expires next week.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mariners are two games out of the last AL wild-card spot with six games remaining. Seattle closes out the season with three games at Houston and hosting the Oakland Athletics.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The defending World Series champion Rangers, who were eliminated from postseason contention on Friday, improved to 7-61 when trailing after six innings.
Others: Rangers RHP Nathan Eovaldi (11-8, 3.96) will face Oakland RHP Mitch Spence (8-9, 4.30) on Tuesday in the opener of the Athletics’ final home series before they relocate to Sacramento next season with plans to move to Las Vegas in 2028.
